intro: Borismene, commonly known as the "butterfly plant," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that often resemble butterflies, hence its common name. The plants typically have hairy stems and leaves, and they are native to various regions in Africa and the Middle East. Borismene species are often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting well to dry conditions. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
